sn11.11:1.2: “Mendicants, in a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he undertook seven vows. And it was because of undertaking these that he achieved the status of Sakka.
sn11.11:1.4: As long as I live, may I support my parents.
sn11.11:1.5: As long as I live, may I honor the elders in the family.
sn11.11:1.6: As long as I live, may I speak gently.
sn11.11:1.7: As long as I live, may I not speak divisively.
sn11.11:1.8: As long as I live, may I live at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
sn11.11:1.9: As long as I live, may I speak the truth.
sn11.11:1.10: As long as I live, may I be free of anger, or should anger arise, may I quickly get rid of it.
sn11.11:1.11: In a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he undertook seven vows. And it was because of undertaking these that he achieved the status of Sakka.
sn11.11:2.1: A person who respects their parents,
sn11.11:2.2: and honors the elders in the family,
sn11.11:2.3: whose speech is gentle and courteous,
sn11.11:3.1: who’s committed to getting rid of stinginess,
sn11.11:3.2: is truthful, and has mastered anger:
sn11.11:3.4: call them truly a good person.”
